name: How to achieve maximum write speed with Python?
caption: stackoverflow.com
description: I'm writing a program that will do high speed data acquisition. The acquisition card can run at up 6.8 GB/s (It's on PCIe3 x8). Right now I'm trying to stream to a RAM disk to see the max write spe...

data.message: Have you tried Go? It should be faster than python for most purposes, and it's not so hard to learn.

on why disk write is as fast as ram write, I believe os.write() might not write to disk directly, it makes a system call to write the data  to OS buffer directly (which is in a ram region described by the file file descriptor returned by os.open() also which writes it to disk at some time in the future that is not related to your program running time) , to force sync the os buffer with disk you need to flush and call os.fsync()
check first comment here 
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7127075/what-exactly-the-pythons-file-flush-is-doing
and python os.fsync()  docs
https://docs.python.org/3/library/os.html
on how to achieve maximum write speed, i don't think there is higher writing speed in python than using os.open and os.write, but you i think the overhead here is all in the data itself, instead of using a string (block) use an array (not list)
https://docs.python.org/3/library/array.html
i believe that should be more efficient.
